newsitem.title: ROMANIA: Bucharest bourse to get three more stocks.
newsitem.headline: Bucharest bourse to get three more stocks.

text.p: Three Romanian companies will join the Bucharest bourse this week, bringing to 23 the total number of traded stocks, the exchange said on Wednesday.

It said the newcomers were Cercom Ariesul SA, a building materials company, Armatura SA, which produces plumbing equipment, and Dorobantul SA, a wool and fibre maker. Their shares will start second-tier trading on Thursday.
Cercom is a private company with a capital of 14 billion lei in shares with a nominal value of 25,000 lei each.

It was privatised under a mass selloff launched in 1995, with 53.7 percent of its equity subscribed for in exchange for coupons. Cercom staff hold 40 percent and the State Ownership Fund (FPS) -- its majority owner before the mass selloff -- has 6.3 percent.

Armatura has a share capital of 15.2 billion lei, or 15.2 million shares with a face value of 1,000 each. It went private in the mass selloff, with 60 percent acquired against coupons and 40 percent bought by its staff, a bourse statement said.
It said Dorobantul, the third stock to join the market, had a share capital of 24 billion lei in shares of 1,000 lei each. Individual shareholders have 61.25 percent and the FPS holds 38.75 percent.
"I expect the newcomers to appeal to investors as they are private companies," a trader said. "Their joining the market will help increase liquidity."
Another stock -- Mefin SA fine mechanics company -- is expected to enter the bourse's second tier next week.

The bourse has only two first-tier listings -- Azomures SA fertiliser maker, which has dominated the bourse since it opened late in 1995, and Oltchim SA chemical plant, which joined the market on Tuesday.
